summary: Project includes a Supabase-backed user sign-up flow with a basic HTML form and client-side signup handler.
architectural_notes: Use Supabase JS v2 client-side to create users via `supabase.auth.signUp({ email, password })` and then insert a profile row into a `users` table keyed by the auth `user.id`.

existing_features.title: Implement an account creation flow that matches the intent of the provided Supabase HTML snippet (Full Name, Email, Password, Create Account) but uses Internet Identity for authentication (no Supabase) and stores the user profile in the Motoko backend keyed by the caller Principal (treat this Principal as the user id).

Frontend: update the Sign Up experience (`frontend/src/pages/SignUpPage.tsx`) to support a simple “Create Account” form that captures Full Name and Email and triggers the new backend basic-profile save after the user authenticates with Internet Identity; avoid asking users for a password since Internet Identity handles authentication.

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement user account creation UI and Supabase Auth sign-up, then store user profile (id, name, email) in a `users` table

Backend: add a dedicated method to store a basic user profile (Full Name + Email) without requiring the full multi-field profile form, while keeping the existing `UserProfile` type and stable storage model unchanged.

projectName: Add simple account creation flow (Full Name + Email) using Internet Identity and backend user profiles
